DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Range 0 to 5 Unit level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 5 Unit level
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SPD]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 5 Unit level
    Set Direction [DIR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Forward [0]
            Reverse [1]
    Set Timer [TMR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RPT]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the kitchen fan to speed 3 and reverse the direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed ranges from 0 (off) to 5 levels. The direction can be either Forward (0) or Reverse (1). The accepted commands include Set Speed (SPD) with a level parameter and Set Direction (DIR) with an enum parameter.

To set the fan speed to 3, I will use the Set Speed command with parameter 3. To reverse the direction, I will use the Set Direction command with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Execute SPD with value=3 to set speed, then DIR with value=1 to reverse direction.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Heat [1]
            Cool [2]
            Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Low [0]
            Medium [1]
            High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]

USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to cool mode and target temperature to 22 degrees Celsius.

I first identify the relevant properties and commands. The thermostat supports modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto. The target temperature can be set between 10.0 and 30.0 °C. The commands to use are Set Mode (SM) with enum parameter and Set Target Temperature (STT) with a float parameter.

To set the thermostat to cool mode, I will send SM with parameter Cool (2). To set the target temperature to 22 °C, I will send STT with parameter 22.0.

Result: Execute SM with value=2 to set cool mode, then STT with value=22.0 to set target temperature.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Off [0]
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [ON]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Off [OFF]
    Set Brightness [SB]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the bedroom light at 75% brightness and set the color temperature to 3000 Kelvin.

Reviewing the device structure, the light's status and brightness range from 0 to 100%. The color temperature can be set between 2700K and 6500K. The commands to use are On with brightness parameter, and Set Color Temperature with Kelvin parameter.

To turn on the light at 75% brightness, I will send the On command with parameter 75. To set the color temperature to 3000K, I will send Set Color Temperature with parameter 3000.

Result: Execute On(75) to turn on the light at 75% brightness, then SCT(3000) to set color temperature to 3000K.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and closed right now?

The device has two properties: Door Status and Lock Status, both enums. Door Status can be Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing. Lock Status can be Locked or Unlocked.

To determine if the door is locked and closed, I would query the current Door Status and Lock Status using the Report Door Status and Report Lock Status commands.

If Door Status is Closed (0) and Lock Status is Locked (0), then the door is locked and closed.

Result: Check RDS and RLS reports; if both return 0, the garage door is locked and closed.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 6 Unit zone_number
    Stop Zone [STOP]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 6 Unit zone_number
    Enable Schedule [ENB]
    Disable Schedule [DIS]
    Query Status [QRY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [RZS]
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]

USER QUERY:
Can you start zone 4 and enable the watering schedule?

The device supports starting and stopping zones numbered 1 to 6. The schedule can be enabled or disabled via commands.

To start zone 4, I will send the Start Zone command with parameter 4. To enable the watering schedule, I will send the Enable Schedule command.

Result: Execute START(4) to start zone 4, then ENB to enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Home Energy Monitor
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit Watts
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range 0 to 100000 Unit kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Active [1]
        Inactive [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [RESET]
    Query Power Usage [QPU]
    Query Energy Consumed [QEC]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [RPU]
    Report Energy Consumed [REC]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and total energy consumed so far?

The device properties include Current Power Usage in Watts and Total Energy Consumed in kWh. To get these values, I can use the Query Power Usage and Query Energy Consumed commands or wait for their reports.

To answer the query, I would send QPU and QEC commands to retrieve current power usage and total energy consumed.

Result: Query current power usage with QPU and total energy consumed with QEC to get the latest readings.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bathroom Humidifier
  ***Properties***
    Humidity Level
      Range 30 to 80 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Mist Intensity
      Range 1 to 5 Unit level
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Mist Intensity [SMI]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 5 Unit level
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Humidity [RH]
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the humidifier and set the mist intensity to level 4.

The humidifier has properties for Status (On/Off), Humidity Level (30-80%), and Mist Intensity (1-5 levels). To fulfill the request, I need to turn the device on and set the mist intensity.

First, send the Turn On command to power the humidifier. Then, send Set Mist Intensity with parameter 4 to adjust the mist level.

Result: Execute ON to turn on the humidifier, then SMI(4) to set mist intensity to level 4.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt Angle [TILT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop Movement [STOP]
    Query Position [QPOS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RPOS]
    Report Status [RSTS]

USER QUERY:
Could you close the window shade halfway and tilt it to 30 degrees?

The shade's position ranges from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open). The tilt angle can be set between -90 and 90 degrees. The commands to use are Close Shade with a percentage parameter and Set Tilt Angle with degrees.

To close the shade halfway, I will send Close Shade with parameter 50. To tilt it to 30 degrees, I will send Set Tilt Angle with parameter 30.

Result: Execute CLOSE(50) to close the shade halfway, then TILT(30) to set tilt angle to 30 degrees.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Internal Temperature
      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Saving Mode
      Enum
        Enabled [1]
        Disabled [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [ST]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Enable Power Saving [EPS]
    Disable Power Saving [DPS]
    Query Door Status [QDS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Door Status [RDS]

USER QUERY:
Set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and enable power saving mode.

The refrigerator's internal temperature can be set between 1 and 10 °C. Power Saving Mode can be enabled or disabled via commands.

To set the temperature to 4 °C, I will send Set Temperature with parameter 4. To enable power saving, I will send Enable Power Saving command.

Result: Execute ST(4) to set temperature to 4 °C, then EPS to enable power saving mode.
